page.title: 12TIN MINING (3)
page.content:
A new company reopened the works in 1852 and two large engines were used to drain the mines, one of them being the largest of its type in the world. In 1857 the price of tin has slumped to Â£40 a ton. The decline had begun, by 1870 mining had ceased. Many of the men and their families had emigrated to North America and Australia.
In 1907 an attempt was made to reopen the mine but their new electric pumps could not cope with the volume of water in the mine and the revival attempt failed.
The prosperity of the mine greatly helped nearby settlements. In Carleen a large chapel was built in 1833, a school was built for 140 children, doctors were available for two pence a month.
